fg.hazmateasiermanagement.database

Class AccessDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • fg.hazmateasiermanagement.database.AccessDatabase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class AccessDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Factory class for Database, contains methods to modify and access the database in an easy way.
    Version:
    2014-10-15
    Author:
    Johansson, Henrik, Stromner, David
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • AccessDatabase

        public AccessDatabase(Database db)

    • Method Detail

      • getCompleteDatabase

        public java.util.List<Element> getCompleteDatabase()
        Returns the entire database in a list consisting of elements.
        Returns:
        database in element format. null if the database contains no elements.

      • getElement

        public Element getElement(int unID)
        Calls on the database.getElement method, convert the cursor that it returns to an element class for easier access.
        Parameters:
        unID - element to be fetched.
        Returns:
        the Element version of the cursor if 'elementID' exist, null otherwise.

      • addElement

        public java.lang.Boolean addElement(int unID,
                           java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.String description,
                           float maxWeight,
                           java.lang.String label,
                           java.lang.String hazmat_image,
                           java.util.List<java.lang.String> not_compatible)
        Calls on the database.addElement method.
        Parameters:
        unID - the UN identification number for the element.
        name - the proper name for the element.
        description - describe the Element in detail.
        maxWeight - maximum allowed total weight of element.
        label - used to show what material that can be shipped together.
        hazmat_image - file name of what image(if any) applies to this element).
        not_compatible - shows which labels this element cannot be shipped with.
        Returns:
        true if it succeeded, false otherwise.

      • removeElement

        public java.lang.Boolean removeElement(int unID)
        Calls on the database.removeElement method.
        Parameters:
        unID - element to remove.
        Returns:
        true if the element was removed, false otherwise.
